tools.name: AddChecklistItemClickup

tools.name: AddSpaceView
tools.description:
Add a new view to a ClickUp space.

    Use this tool to add a List, Board, Calendar, Table, Timeline, Workload, Activity, Map, Chat, or Gantt view to a ClickUp Space.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the ClickUp space where the view will be added. It should be an integer.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

Add a target to a specific goal in ClickUp.

tools.name: ClickupLegacyTimeTracking
tools.description:
Log time entry for a ClickUp task using legacy endpoint.

This tool allows logging time entries for a specific ClickUp task using a legacy API endpoint. It should be called when you need to record time spent on tasks, although it's recommended to use the updated Time Tracking API for new implementations.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the task for which time is being logged. This can refer to either the standard task ID or a custom task ID if specified.

parameters.name: end_timestamp
parameters.description: Epoch timestamp indicating when the time tracking ended for the task.

parameters.name: start_time_unix_epoch
parameters.description: The start time of the time entry in Unix epoch format. This is required to log time for a task.

parameters.name: time_spent_seconds
parameters.description: Duration of time spent on the task in seconds. This is the time you want to log for the specific task.

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Set to true to reference a task by its custom task ID.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Provide the Workspace ID when `custom_task_ids` is `true`.

tools.name: CreateFolderFromTemplate
tools.description:
Creates a new folder from a template in a ClickUp space.

    This tool creates a new folder using a predefined template within a specified ClickUp space. It can also incorporate nested assets like lists and tasks from the template into the new folder. Templates must be added to your Workspace before use. The operation can be executed asynchronously or synchronously.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: clickup_space_id
parameters.description: ID of the ClickUp Space where the folder will be created.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: folder_template_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder template to be used for creating a new folder in a ClickUp space. Ensure the template is added to your Workspace.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"name": "New Folder", "description": "This is a folder created from a template."}

tools.name: CreateTeamView
tools.description:
Add various views to a workspace at the Everything Level.

    This tool allows you to add different types of views such as List, Board, Calendar, Table, Timeline, Workload, Activity, Map, Chat, or Gantt to a specified workspace within a team. Use this when you need to create or organize views for better workspace management.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the workspace where the view will be added. This corresponds to the team or workspace ID.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: GetFilteredTeamTasks
tools.description:
Retrieve tasks from a workspace based on specified filters.

This tool retrieves tasks from a specified workspace that meet certain criteria. The response is limited to 100 tasks per page, and only tasks that the user has access to are returned. The tool is useful for viewing filtered task information from multiple lists, folders, or spaces.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace to retrieve tasks from. Must be an integer.

parameters.name: assignee_ids
parameters.description: Filter tasks by assignee using their ClickUp user IDs.

parameters.name: custom_task_type_filters
parameters.description: Filter tasks by custom task types. Use `0` for tasks, `1` for Milestones, and other numbers for Workspace-defined types.

parameters.name: display_tasks_in_reverse_order
parameters.description: Set to true to display tasks in reverse order.

parameters.name: due_date_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks with due dates earlier than the specified Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: due_date_greater_than
parameters.description: Filter tasks by a due date greater than the specified Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_custom_fields
parameters.description: Include tasks with specific values in Custom Fields. Provide an array of objects with field_id, operator, and value keys.

parameters.name: filter_by_date_created_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks created before this date. Specify as Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_date_done_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks by the completion date after the given Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_done_date_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks completed before a specific date. Provide the date in Unix time (milliseconds).

parameters.name: filter_by_list_ids
parameters.description: An array of list IDs to filter tasks by. Example: ["1234", "6789"].

parameters.name: filter_by_project_ids
parameters.description: An array of folder IDs to filter tasks by specific folders. For example, ['1234', '6789'].

parameters.name: filter_by_space_ids
parameters.description: An array of space IDs to filter tasks by. Example values: ['1234', '6789'].

parameters.name: filter_by_tags
parameters.description: Filter tasks by tags. Use `%20` for spaces within tags. Example: `urgent%20task`.

parameters.name: filter_by_update_date_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks updated before a specific date, provided as Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_updated_date_greater_than
parameters.description: Filter tasks by their updated date, greater than the specified Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_created_date_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks by creation date greater than the specified Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: include_closed_tasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include closed tasks, false to exclude them. By default, closed tasks are excluded.

parameters.name: include_markdown_description
parameters.description: Set to true to return task descriptions in Markdown format. Default is false.

parameters.name: include_subtasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include subtasks, or false to exclude them. Defaults to false (exclude).

parameters.name: order_tasks_by
parameters.description: Specify the field by which to order tasks. Options include: 'id', 'created', 'updated', 'due_date'. Defaults to 'created'.

parameters.name: page_number_to_fetch
parameters.description: Page number to fetch, starting at 0, in the paginated list of tasks.

parameters.name: parent_task_id
parameters.description: Include the parent task ID to return subtasks in the response.

parameters.name: status_filters
parameters.description: Filter tasks by their statuses. Use '%20' for spaces. Example: ['to%20do', 'in%20progress'].

parameters.name: filter_by_watchers

parameters.name: filter_date_created_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks created after this Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.description: Filter tasks completed after a specified date in Unix time (milliseconds).

parameters.name: filter_date_updated_after

parameters.name: filter_date_updated_less_than

parameters.name: filter_due_date_greater_than
parameters.description: Filter tasks by a due date greater than the provided Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: include_archived_tasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include archived tasks in the results. By default, archived tasks are excluded.

parameters.name: include_closed_tasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include closed tasks in the response. Defaults to false to exclude them.

parameters.name: include_markdown_task_descriptions
parameters.description: Set to true to return task descriptions in Markdown format.

parameters.name: include_subtasks
parameters.description: Set to true to include subtasks; false to exclude them. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: page_number_to_fetch

tools.name: GetTimeEntriesInDateRange
tools.description:
Retrieve time entries within a specified date range.

Use this tool to view time entries filtered by start and end dates. By default, it returns entries from the last 30 days for the authenticated user. To access entries for other users, use the 'assignee' parameter. You may apply location filters with 'space_id', 'folder_id', 'list_id', or 'task_id', but only one at a time. Note: Negative duration entries indicate a running timer.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the response content. Usually set to 'application/json'.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Specify the Workspace ID for filtering time entries when using custom task IDs.

parameters.name: end_date_unix_milliseconds
parameters.description: Specify the end date in Unix time (milliseconds) to filter time entries up to this point.

parameters.name: filter_by_assignee
parameters.description: Filter by user IDs. Use commas to separate multiple IDs (e.g., '1234,9876'). Only accessible to Workspace Owners/Admins.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: Include time entries for tasks in a specific folder by providing its ID. Only one location filter (space, folder, list, or task) can be used at a time.

parameters.name: include_approval_details
parameters.description: Include detailed approval information for each time entry, such as Approver ID, Approved Time, List of Approvers, and Approval Status.

parameters.name: include_approval_history
parameters.description: Set to true to include the approval history for each time entry, with status changes, notes, and approvers.

parameters.name: include_location_names
parameters.description: Include the names of the List, Folder, and Space in the response along with their IDs when set to true.

parameters.name: include_only_billable_entries
parameters.description: Set to `true` to include only billable time entries, or `false` for non-billable entries.

parameters.name: include_task_tags
parameters.description: Set to true to include task tags in the response for associated time entries.

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: Include time entries associated only with tasks in the specified Space using its ID.

parameters.name: specific_list_id
parameters.description: Include only time entries associated with tasks in a specified List by providing the List ID.

parameters.name: specific_task_id
parameters.description: Include only time entries associated with the specified task.

parameters.name: start_date_in_unix_milliseconds
parameters.description: The start date of the time entries in Unix time (milliseconds).

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Set to true to reference tasks by their custom task IDs. Requires specifying the team_id.

parameters.name: workspace_id_for_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Provide the Workspace ID when referencing a task by its custom task ID, and `custom_task_ids` is set to true.

tools.name: RemoveTagsFromTimeEntries
tools.description:
Remove labels from specific time entries.

    Use this tool to remove labels from time entries without affecting the labels in the Workspace.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Workspace from which to remove labels from time entries. Must be an integer.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

parameters.name: time_entry_id
parameters.description: The ID of a time entry. This ID can be obtained using the Get Time Entries Within a Date Range endpoint.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace (team) where the time entry resides.

tools.name: ViewWorkspaceCustomFields
tools.description:
Retrieve Workspace-level Custom Fields in ClickUp.

Use this tool to view custom fields accessible at the workspace level in ClickUp. It doesn't include fields from Space, Folder, or List levels.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: The MIME type of the content. Typically set to 'application/json' for JSON data.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Workspace to retrieve custom fields for. This identifies which Workspace's fields you want to view.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: ViewWorkspaceGoals
tools.description:
View the Goals available in a Workspace.

This tool retrieves the goals available in a specific workspace on ClickUp. It should be used when you need to access or display information about the goals associated with a given workspace.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the workspace to view its goals.

parameters.name: include_completed_goals
parameters.description: Indicate whether to include completed goals in the results. Set to true to include completed goals, or false to exclude them.

<Callout type="info">
The ClickupApi MCP Server uses the Auth Provider with id `arcade-clickup` to connect to users' ClickupApi accounts. In order to use the MCP Server, you must configure the `arcade-clickup` auth provider.
</Callout>

- For detailed configuration, see the [ClickUp Auth Provider documentation](/references/auth-providers/clickup).

summary:
Arcade's ClickupApi toolkit enables seamless interaction with the ClickUp API, allowing developers to manage tasks, views, checklists, and more within their ClickUp workspaces. **Capabilities**:
- Create, update, and delete tasks, lists, and views.
- Add comments and checklists to tasks for effective collaboration.
- Retrieve and manage time entries, goals, and custom fields.
- Organize tasks by using tags and dependencies for better workflow management.

**OAuth**:
- Provider: ClickUp; Scopes: None. 

**Secrets**: None.
